I had a thought strike me a few days ago when thinking about the possibility of aliens existing. It deals with the possibility that aliens that are similar to humans existing somewhere in the galaxy.
 
 First a few assumptions have to be made. #1, if the Christian God exists then there probably are no aliens. Perhaps I'm wrong in making this assumption but I don't believe that God would have needed to create aliens. #2, the aliens are similar to humans in that they treasure power and are intellegent enought of follow a similar path of technological evolution as we have followed. Aliens are often portrayed and thought to be intellegent and human like in how they operate.
 
 First we should consider the likelihood of life forming on a given planet. It is almost 0 over any period of time. Now lets assume life does form on a given planet and it evolves to a level equal to humans. The humans level of civilization will inevitably cause 1 of 2 things. Either humans will kill themselves off or we will control the whole of the universe given only a few million years to work with. With the universe being billions of years old it really doesn't take a whole lot of time before an advanced species would be located at all corners of the universe. Since the universe is still here and relatively uninhabited we shall assume no advanced species has ever survived more than a few million years without destroying themselves. So the lifespan of an advanced form of life is very short compared to the time the universe has been around. This makes the probability of there being two advanced species around at the same time all the less likely and almost unbelievable.
 
 My conclusion is that it is essentially impossible that another form of advanced life exists in the universe today given my two assumptions. Even if two advanced forms of life did exist at one time the chance of them meeting is even more unlikely as is the idea that the two species will be anywhere near the same level of technology as the alien species were in the movie Signs and Independence Day.
